page.para: My Grand/ma learned to jug/gle in the kitch/en. “Look at me, Grand/pa!”
“I can jug/gle an/y/thing,” said Grand/ma. But Grand/pa wasn’t sure.
Grand/ma jug/gled at the bank. She jug/gled in the li/brar/y.
Grand/ma jug/gled man/goes at the mar/ket. But that did not end well.
Some peo/ple didn’t like Grand/ma’s jug/gling.
Grand/pa was wor/ried. This jug/gling might get Grand/ma in/to trou/ble.
Then he had an i/de/a! He bought Grand/ma a gift.
Her ver/y own set of jug/gling balls! Grand/ma was so pleased.
Grand/ma jug/gled day and night. E/ven when the moon was in the sky!
